Reviews.Title: Omnia 7
Reviews.Author: J. Liang
Reviews.Content: I purchased an Omnia 7 through Amazon (Prime eligible). Not a 3rd party seller.I received an unopened box, unlocked, unbranded body logo, t-mobile load screen version. Initial language was German.I am currently using this phone in the US -- At&t.; Cellular data and MMS did not work out of the box. You will need to download Samsung's 'Network Profile' app from the Marketplace --> Samsung Zone.At&t; uses 850 and 1900 MHz for 3G data. Samsung Omnia 7 has 900, 1900 and 2100 3G. Despite the lack of 850 MHz, I am able to receive 3G data (3g/3g+ --Will not show H--) in certain areas.  I am able to toggle between 2g (edge) and 3g (HSDPA).Also, remember to update your OS version through Zune. Out of the box, it did not have the latest available NoDo update (7.0.7392.0). I went from OS version 7.0.7004.0  to 7.0.7008.0 to 7.0.7392.0. To check your version: Settings --> about --> more infoBy the way, battery life is unbelievable. 12+ hours easily! This is with 3g, Google mail push, 1+ hour web browsing, casual texting and moderate use of music player.11/01: If you have an unbranded, t-mobile load screen version, you may now update to Mango via Zune.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone but not Perfect
Reviews.Author: nguyen tran
Reviews.Content: First impression, Windows 7 is pretty similar to Iphone but it gives users a little more freedom. Everything must be done through Zune software which is kind of a nuisance. Once a facebook account is set up, everything is synced to the phone contact. The phone GPS will not work without internet! There's no equalizer and the sound quality is not impressive (worse than my Nokia N85) The screen is simply amazing (trust me, it's really amazing). Personally, I think the screen is about the right size, not too small nor too big. The device has no problem playing back 720p video clips. Market place is not as good as Apple but I think it's okay. Who wants thousands of applications on his phone? There's no memory expansion lot so make sure you can live with 8gb memory (6.99 gb available) Wifi connection is very easy to set up (basically, there's no set up necessary, just type in the passwords, and that's it). The phone quickly connects to a network when wifi is on (less than 10 seconds). The device only need around 20-30 seconds to power up which is impressive. The battery lasts around 4 days with slight use (a few brief phone calls, a few text message, half an hour surfing web with wifi, playing back a few 720p videos ...) One last thing, the 5mp camera takes great pictures and if you're not a professional photographer, you would be pleased with the photos quality.Overall, if you want something different from Iphone or Android, the windows 7 is a pretty okay alternative. Keep in mind that no operating system is perfect.

Reviews.Title: The best windows phone to date.
Reviews.Author: enders4you

} } } Length:: 2:48 MinsThis one of the better windows phones out there on the market. With its thin profile and large 4in screen make this a first choice. I have had the HTC HD7 and Dell Venue Pro Windows phones for a few months and this is by far the best and a little faster than the other devices.As for the mobile service, I've noticed that for T-mobile users, this version will not support 3G, you will have to find the T-mobile European version if you want 3G or 3G+ as for AT&T; users, everything works fine but depends on the area you live in to get a 3G option on the device. Maybe there are some hacks that I need to discover to unlock that option of T-mobile.The camera is on of the best with a ton of options and features to choose from and speakers are great and loud without any distortion or crackling. This will be my preferred windows phone until something better comes out.

Reviews.Title: Stellar! Easy to get running
Reviews.Author: P. Smith
Reviews.Content: I got my Omnia7 in no time. I guess this one was from Germany as the initial welcome menu was willkommen!I had to use babel fish for only two initial questions, then I could pick English and all was well. I even got the NoDo update as soon as Zune was up. I used my existing LiveID. LiveDrive is sweet. Office is sweeter. The phone has been 100% solid for the 8 weeks I've had it. Now anxiously awaiting Mango!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Phone
Reviews.Author: Jose P. Cortés P. "José."
Reviews.Content: It'll be biased or anything you could think, but this is THE phone, the best phone I've ever had.It's quite good looking, with a nice metal back (including battery cover), the better screen I've seen anywhere, and really likes that the Windows Button is a hardware button.On the OS Side, well, Windows Phone 7 is perfect: fast, reliable, people-centric, good Social integration and with a great on-screen keyboard, even with my huge fingers.The only minimun downside is that, is unlocked but not unbranded, so I had to flash it to get Mango Faster (but still waiting), but it's safe if you follow instructions on XDA-Devs site (do it ONLY if you know what you're doing). The good side of being Orange Branded is the pretty Orange-theme, much better than any other theme available.I'm using the BoxWave Samsung Omnia 7 GT-i8700 DuoSuit (Jet Black) and it's a perfect match, so you can keep your valuable phone safe and without scraths.

Reviews.Title: love the phone!
Reviews.Author: kmh963
Reviews.Content: This phone replaced a samsung galaxy s, which took an unsheduled swim. I much prefer the windows os to the android os; much neater, cleaner, more organized. Downloaded the mango update when released with no problems, like the improvements I've noticed so far, but still looking for the slide show button in the photo viewer and the equalizer in the zune player which were standard equipment on the galaxy. While both phones have 1GHZ processors, this phone is faster, more responsive, smoother operating. The zune is much cooler than the music player on the Galaxy (but for the lack of an equalizer). Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone Overall
Reviews.Author: R. Yu
Reviews.Content: Phone is good overall. I came from using the Nokia e71, which was a great solid phone. This is my first touchscreen phone so I am extra careful with it to not drop or bump it. The metal backing is nice and feels solid, but it is also so smooth that it is slippery. I like the OS but there are some things that I am used to from the Nokia phone that I wish was found in the Windows OS. The volume when making calls can be louder and wished it was, otherwise the phone's ring and alerts are loud. Wish there was a outside notification light. And wish there was a GPS function, just using bing maps is not a good substitute. And I find that the connectivity of the antenna is not as strong as the one from my Nokia e71. The phone has no external branding but the boot screen is tmobile. when i am on internet explorer and press the search button it brings me to a google page in german, i wish it was in english. But overall I like the phone and can't wait for Mango this fall! Hopefully I will not have a problem updating to that.

Reviews.Title: Very pleasantly surprised!!
Reviews.Author: Edgar H. Tan, MD "The Healer"
Reviews.Content: This is the phone with a bright future down the road!! OS is tops and much better than iOS which I also own (iphone 4). The screen is simply stunning abd the ease of use is simply the best!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this phone to use just for fun. To make apps on and install pre-builds. This phone feels so much nicer than the Focus that this is now my primary phone and my Focus has now become my test device running Mango. This phone has metal backing and plastic top and bottom which give it better reception than full metal phones and more durability than cheap plastic phones. I also get faster download speeds when this phone gets a 3G+ signal.

Reviews.Title: BEST PHONE EVER
Reviews.Author: TIMOTRON
Reviews.Content: Phone is Great Happy with everything blazing fast !!!! Tip for AT&T; and Straight talk user's who have a trouble with data connection! Go to Network profile choose AT&T; active profile then go to settings then Cellular on the bottom of the screen push 'edit apn ' and at the apn just wright (att.mvno) That it enjoy blazing fast 3G+ data connection and Amazing phone

Reviews.Title: Samsung Omnia 7
Reviews.Author: simplydj
Reviews.Content: Snappy OS, slick appearance, long list of features, what more could you possibly want? Feels like a high quality product too.

Reviews.Title: St**** the Samsung US
Reviews.Author: Arteesvn
Reviews.Content: So far this cellphone is very nice. I haven't used it, just opened the box and charging it. However, this cellphone can't be registered at [...]. Looks like When Amazon sells this cellphone, Samsung of the U.S won't get any benfits from this transaction. Thus, when I was chatting with an online customer service. She said that I can't register for this phone by using online website; so, I asked if there was a way to register the phone. She said she had no information about that. Finally, I tried to go to [...] and it was easy to register this phone. One star is deducted because of SS U.S service.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful phone with an excellent OS
Reviews.Author: Sriram R. Krishnan "Krishnan"
Reviews.Content: Basic usageThis is a very nice phone to use. Wonderful touch and feel. Some people will complain it very touch sensitive, but I'd say that this is the best touch sensitive phone I have used so far. Basic features on the phone are excellent, call quality is very good, send and receive email features are excellent as well.Pretty slick and wonderful, wonderful display.Now that we are done with the basics let's move on....WP7 OS and updatesEasily the most stable OS from MS. Wonderful job. Don't hesitate a second to choose WP7. I was initially confused between choosing iOS and WP7, and I glad I chose WP7. Not that iOS is bad or WP7 is better. Once you start using WP7 you will never think for a second you should have decided on something else. Very easy to connect with you PC to transfer files, contacts and other information. Once you connect your phone to Zune updates happen automatically without any fuss. No issues what so ever it's been a very smooth experience. I am so happy with WP7 that I plan to buy one for my parents too.These are some of the must have WP7 apps. I find all of them very useful and I am sure you will also like them [...]AccessoriesThis phone comes with in build 8GB storage. THat's no where near to what I like. I carry a lot of books with me and I need them always for reference, read etc. so I bough additional storage. Here's what I bought[...]There were no issues in adding this additional storage. After browsing the net I was a bit concerned about additional storage. There were a lot of complains about SD cards on WP7. My first thought was I'll buy the phone, add the card, if it works, I'll keep the phone, else return it for good. I was able to add additional storage in my first attempt. Instructions I followed are from this site [...]All the accessories for the phone are good and live up to their expectation.The only downside of this phone is battery. I need to charge it almost every day. And it take more than an hour to get completly charged. That to me is very bad. That's where iPhone scores a big plus for me. Samsung needs to come up either with better battery or with a faster charger.

Reviews.Title: awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Dr. Leibnitz
Reviews.Content: After owning an old Windows Mobile 6.5 phone for many years, I had sworn off any Windows Mobile devices. Finally, took a plunge on this phone as a gift. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. Windows Mobile has come a long way, the UI is pleasant and intuitive. The phone itself is well built, fast and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: smart phone starter
Reviews.Author: MsGreenTea
Reviews.Content: had this phone for three weeks now and so far there isn't any noticeable malfunctions. The display screen is amazing but it gets smear alot and have finger prints all over it so I have to constantly wipe the screen. this is my first smart phone and i think it's a good starter phone. i would recommend this phone for new user to smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: S. Veerapaneni "Sri v"
Reviews.Content: To my surprise windows phone is awesome. I had IPhone but this is much better and faster. I would never go back to Andriod or IPhone.

Reviews.Title: simple & clean OS
Reviews.Author: fadhli atari
Reviews.Content: i received omnia 7 few days back with orange carrier. I installed zune software on my laptop and try to update the cellphone, but it is not detectable, as it say device is not recognized.So, what I do, is find the drive GT-8700 from samsung uk, and install it. Finally zune detect the cellphone, BUT failed to initiate updated.Then again, drive by eager for taste of mango updates, I just reset the cellphone to factory state from setting menu. After that, walah~ i finally can update it to mango.There are application for orange in the apps menu. I just uninstalled them. Very easy to do.The W7 phone as you can see on many positive review are true, with minor seatback, but windows will improve it before next year.Currently cannot use skpe, custom ringtones on this phone, but there will be an update soon.The battery life is amazing, about 1 days and 9 hours after full charge. Maybe it will be shorter with internet use. I'm using T-mobile, and its only support edge (no 3G) as other previous reviewer says  before me.Overall, awesome windows phone. :D

Reviews.Title: Too difficult to get running
Reviews.Author: tonygeno "tonygeno"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this on Friday and as usual Amazon had great shipping. I got it the next day with Prime upgraded to overnight shipping.The Omnia 7 is a beautiful piece of hardware with a wonderfully bright and clear screen. It exudes quality and is definitely a step up from the Samsung Focus. However, I did not have the greatest luck getting this going.First off, the phone is branded Orange (from the UK) and you get all the Orange apps and splash screen. (I thought I was buying an unbranded phone). Once I downloaded the network setting app from the marketplace I was able to set it for ATT at which point I got all the ATT apps as well as the Orange apps. Hmm. This was getting kind of crowded.Signal strength was fine and I was able to get 3G. The phone was running an old software release and I was able to update it a couple of times (but not to the latest version).I used the Windows Phone Connector for the Mac and it would not reliably connect. In fact, I got it to connect only twice in about 20 attempts. Other Windows 7 phones have had no such problem, so I have no idea why I couldn't get it to connect reliably.Given that you can get a Samsung Focus for $350 w/o contract from AT&T;, I don't think it is that great a deal anymore, particularly given the set up issues I experienced and the fact that it only runs on one of AT&T;'s 3G bands.

ProductInfo.Features:
GSM Quad Band (850/900/1,800/1,900MHz), 3G 900/1,900/2,100MHz (HSUPA 5.6Mbps, HSDPA 7.2Mbps )
122.4 x 64.2 x 10.99mm, Display: 16M WVGA SUPER AMOLED, 4.0"
Camera Resolution: 5 Megapixel with 4x Digital zoom, LED Flash, and Auto Focus. HD Video Recording 720p (up to 25fps)
Internal Memory: 8GB, Operation System: Windows Phone OS 7, Browser: Internet Explorer
Talk time: up to 8.7 hours, Standby: up to 390 hours
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung I8700 Omnia 7 Unlocked Smartphone with Windows Phone 7, Touch Screen, 5 MP Camera, 8 GB Built-in Memory--No Warranty (Black)
